meta.title: Information Updates Regarding COVID-19 - Scott County Schools

meta.content: Click here to see an archive of information shared by Scott County Schools as well as helpful links and resources from reliable government and health officials, including recommendations from the CDC.

div.strong: Text Options for the Visually Impaired

a.title: Change the color of the page to white on black
Change the color of the page to black on white
Change the color of the page to yellow on black

div.label: Translate Page

span.span: For the latest information on the Coronavirus in Kentucky, please visit www.kycovid19.ky.gov
COVID-19 Hotline: (800) 722-5725

Based recommendations made by the Governor today, schools in Scott County will remain closed for in person instruction for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. In Scott County, NTI days will continue through Friday, May 15, 2020. More information to follow regarding assignments for NTI days beyond May 1. Meal distribution will continue without disruption. High school principals are working closely with student leaders on plans to celebrate the graduating Class of 2020. Additional information available soon.
Español
School in Scott County will remain closed through Friday, May 1. We will continue NTI days during this extension.

April 15-17 will be set aside for students to catch up on their work and have any questions answered by their teachers. No new assignments will be posted or distributed for April 15, April 16, or April 17.
If you indicated access to the internet and a preference to get NTI work for your child online, assignments for April 20-May 1 will be available on the district website on Tuesday, April 14.

If you or your child indicated that you prefer a paper packet, there are several opportunities to pick up the next batch of assignments. You can stop by your child’s school from 10am-2pm on Tuesday, April 14. Pick up is also available on Wednesday, April 15 from 8-10am or 5-7pm.

If you have questions or need to make special arrangements to get your child’s assignments, please contact your child’s teacher who is available each NTI day from 9-12pm and 1-4pm. Visit: www.scott.kyschools.us and select the NTI graphic to find assignments and contact information.
Español CLICK HERE
April 6, 2020
Beginning April 6, meals will be distributed on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday from 10am-12pm at the following mobile sites and school pick-up locations. Times also apply to scheduled home delivery.
Bashford/Degaris Mill/Winners Circle/Overlook/Scotland Woods/Fat Kats
Clairmont Apartments
Creekside Elementary School
Eagle Creek Baptist Church
Eastern Elementary School
Elizabeth Street/Ed Davis/Northern Heights/Peninsula
Garth Elementary School
Georgetown Estates A & B
Scott County High School
Southern Elementary School
Stamping Ground Elementary School
April 2, 2020
School in Scott County will remain closed through Friday, May 1. We will continue NTI days during this extension.
Meal Distribution over Spring Break
Multiple day meal kits distributed on March 27 and April 1.
Pick-up locations remain the same. Last day for pick-up at GMS is March 27.
Home delivery will follow the same schedule on these two days.
Beginning April 6, meal kits distributed on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday from 10am-12pm.

strong.span: Georgetown/ Scott County COVID-19 Food and Medical Essentials Helpline

span.span: Are you self-isolated and can't get groceries, medicine or other essential items because...
You have a compromised immune system?
You are elderly and need to limit contact with the public?
You have been instructed, by a medical professional, to quarantine yourself?

Call (502) 867-2004 or (502) 867-2005 to speak with a community volunteer. The Helpline will take calls Monday through Friday 8:00am to 4:00pm. Please use this Helpline only if you have no other option for assistance.

span.style: mso-ascii-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-bidi; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA;

span.span: Meal service continues Monday-Friday, including week of March 30.

span.span: Pick up times will be 12-2pm daily, Monday-Friday, on NTI days beginning Tuesday, March 24, 2020.
Two meals distributed at a time so that families only have to leave home for pick up once per day.

span.span: Assignments posted online March 19, 2020
Available for pick up for those who previously indicated need for packets
Pick up at all schools March 19 & March 20 from 7-10am and 5-7pm

a.span: Steps to Prevent Illness from the Centers from Disease Control and Prevention

span.span: Reminders for proper hygiene and ways to care for yourself and others outlined in this resource from the CDC. Available in English and Spanish (click Español at the top of the menu to translate).
Overview of school cancellation information effective March 16, 2020 as well as suspension of travel and extra-curricular activities and meal service plan for families.
